Header: No apprehensions should be made of election related violence; Elections Chief
Content: Election Commissioner Mahinda Deshapriya emphasizes that no apprehensions should be made of election related violence or unrest. He ensured that no such incidents will occur at the Presidential election. The Elections Chief called on the voters to exercise their franchise reiterating that the voting is a right they enjoy. He ensured that vote rigging will be prevented, at all costs. The Election Commissioner also spoke of how the votes and preferences should be marked in the ballot paper. If only a vote is marked, a cross or the digit one can be used. However if preferences are being marked, numbers should be used accordingly.
